[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: InPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp] [Layout validation] Is the layout validated to ensure it actually represents the resource being modified in-place, or can layout substitution attacks cause type confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: ResourceGroupInPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp] [No layout field] This variant lacks a layout field unlike InPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp - how are delayed fields materialized without type information? Can this cause materialization failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: ResourceGroupInPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp] [Comment on line 248] 'Actual information of which individual tag has delayed fields was read' is not tracked - can attackers claim to have modified all group members when they only modified one, manipulating gas charges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: ResourceGroupInPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp] [materialized_size for groups] Does materialized_size represent the total group size or only the modified portion? Ambiguity here could cause gas miscalculations. (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: ResourceGroupInPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp] [Metadata scope] Does the single metadata field apply to the entire resource group or only modified members? Can this cause metadata inconsistencies across group members? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: ResourceGroupInPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp] [Traversal requirement] Comment line 249 says 'we need to traverse and materialize all tags anyways' - can attackers exploit O(n) traversal costs by creating groups with thousands of members? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Enum: AbstractResourceWriteOp] [Variant transitions] Can an operation start as Write, transition to WriteWithDelayedFields during execution, then to InPlaceDelayedFieldChange, causing size tracking inconsistencies across the transition? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Enum: AbstractResourceWriteOp] [Serialization] Is AbstractResourceWriteOp serialized for network transmission? If so, can Byzantine validators send malformed variants causing deserialization errors and crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Enum: AbstractResourceWriteOp] [Clone implementation] The enum derives Clone - can deep cloning of large TriompheArc<MoveTypeLayout> objects cause memory exhaustion or performance degradation attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Enum: AbstractResourceWriteOp] [PartialEq implementation] The enum derives PartialEq - does comparing WriteWithDelayedFieldsOp correctly handle TriompheArc pointer equality vs structural equality of layouts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Enum: AbstractResourceWriteOp] [Debug implementation] The Debug trait could leak sensitive information about write operations - can attackers use debug logs to infer private state information? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Function: materialized_size()] [Underreporting] Can an attacker construct a WriteWithDelayedFieldsOp where materialized_size is None, causing write_op.project_write_op_size() to return None and avoid all gas charges? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Function: materialized_size()] [Delayed field resolution] If delayed fields expand significantly during materialization (e.g., 10x size increase), but materialized_size was set based on pre-materialization size, can attackers underpay for actual storage used? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Function: prev_materialized_size()] [Fee manipulation] By manipulating prev_materialized_size, can attackers make modifications appear as creations (prev size 0) or creations appear as modifications (prev size > 0) to exploit different fee structures? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Function: materialized_size()] [ResourceGroupSize type] What prevents ResourceGroupSize.get() from returning u64::MAX, causing integer overflow in size delta calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: GroupWrite] [Inner ops gas] Are inner_ops individually gas-metered, or only the group-level metadata_op? Can attackers add many small inner_ops to bypass per-operation gas charges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: GroupWrite] [Inner ops partial application] If inner_ops are applied sequentially and the transaction aborts mid-way, can this leave the resource group in a partially updated inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Function: metadata_mut()] [Metadata loss] If metadata is updated via metadata_mut() but the transaction fails, is metadata properly rolled back, or can failed transactions leave ghost metadata entries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/abstract_write_op.rs] [Struct: InPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp] [State key missing] InPlaceDelayedFieldChangeOp doesn't store a state key - how is the target resource identified? Can this cause operations to target wrong resources? (High)
